item.title: Optimal Regression Design
item.description: Introduction to Optimal Regression Design In statistical modeling, especially in regression analysis, we often face the question: ‚ÄúWhere and how should we collect data to obtain the most accurate parameter estimates?‚Äù This question is answered by Optimal Experimental Design, a field that seeks to identify the best sampling scheme under a specified statistical model. üéØ General Objective Let the model be a linear regression: \[ Y_i = \mathbf{f}(x_i)^\top \boldsymbol{\beta} + \varepsilon_i,\quad \varepsilon_i \sim \mathcal{N}(0, \sigma^2) \] where:

item.title: MFCF computing resource shortguide
item.description: Only read if you wanna use school server Which Operating System do you use? In all OS, you can use Terminal or cmd to connect, but I perfer not using it as a beginner. Windows, depends on the version of your OS‚Ä¶ but I strongly recommend using WSL2. Otherwise, you may use Putty. In addition, I think MobaXterm is a good choice to connect to the servers. MacOS, well‚Ä¶ you may just use terminal.

item.title: Example R Markdown Post
item.description: Using R Markdown for Blog Posts This is an example of how to use R Markdown to create blog posts with executable R code. Example Plot Let‚Äôs create a simple visualization: # Create some sample data set.seed(123) data <- data.frame( x = 1:100, y = cumsum(rnorm(100)) ) # Create a plot ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_line(color = "steelblue", size = 1) + geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = TRUE) + theme_minimal() + labs(title = "Random Walk with Trend Line", x = "Time", y = "Value") Tables You can also create nice tables:

item.title: Project Descriptions
item.description: Back to main site This is an example page.

Resources Page Guide This directory contains your resource posts and materials. Here’s how to use it: Adding Resource Posts Create a new markdown file in this directory (e.g., my-resource.md) Use the following front matter: --- title: "Your Resource Title" date: 2025-01-20 description: "Brief description of the resource" tags: ["tag1", "tag2"] categories: ["resources"] --- Write your content in markdown format Add any files (PDFs, code, etc.) to the static/ directory Types of Resources You Can Add Tutorials: Step-by-step guides Code examples: Scripts and code snippets Data sets: Links to useful data Tools and software: Reviews and recommendations Research materials: Notes, papers, presentations Course materials: Lecture notes, assignments Documentation: How-to guides and manuals File Organization Keep related files in organized subdirectories Use descriptive filenames Include proper metadata in front matter Link to external resources when appropriate Example Structure content/resources/ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ _index.
